text: Tallahatta Springs, once called Lowder Springs, is an unincorporated community in Clarke County, Alabama, United States. It was once known for its mineral springs at the headwaters of Tallahatta Creek. A health resort was established here in the middle of the 19th century. Language scholars believe Tallahatta to be an adaptation of two Choctaw language words: tali (rock) and hata (silver/white), literally "white rock." ==Geography== Tallahatta Springs is located at at an elevation of . ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Alabama Category:Unincorporated communities in Clarke County, Alabama
title: Tallahatta Springs, Alabama
